content: itty bitty kitty committee © akabekobotan 2024 this work is licensed under a creative commons attribution-noncommercial-sharealike 4 0 international license see http //creativecommons org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4 0/ meow materials tools and notions 10g dk weight yarn in main colour 3 0mm crochet hook small amount of yarn in stitch markers contrasting colour wool or tapestry needle polyester fibrefill scissors pattern notes uk crochet symbols are used throughout this pattern see http //www simplycrochetmag co uk/2013/07/04/uk-and-us-crochet-conversion- chart/ for conversions gauge is not critical but keep stitches tight to prevent stuffing from leaking out stitches used chain slip_stitch double_crochet invdec french knot straight stitch invisible decrease invdec tutorial with video https //bellacococrochet com/invisible- decrease/ project is approximately 6cm long and 4cm wide when made with indicated yarn © akabekobotan 2024 pattern start with main colour foundation chain 6 5ch plus 1 turning chain which should be skipped at the beginning of round 2 round 1 3dc in 2nd chain from hook 3dc 3dc in last chain and working around the back of the foundation chain 3dc round 2 skip the turning chain *2dc in 1 st* three times 3 double_crochet *2dc in 1 st* three times 3 double_crochet round 3 *double_crochet 2dc in 1 st* three times 3 double_crochet *double_crochet 2dc in 1 st* three times 3 double_crochet round 4 *2dc 2dc in 1 st* three times 3 double_crochet *2dc 2dc in 1 st* three times 3 double_crochet round 5-9 double_crochet around round 10 *invdec 2dc* three times double_crochet to end of round round 11 *invdec double_crochet* three times double_crochet to end of round round 12 2dc invdec place marker 2dc invdec round 13 double_crochet into marked st of round 12 3dc round 14-17 double_crochet to end of round break yarn and pull through leaving a long end with a wool needle run the end through the front loops of round 17 and pull tight to secure assembly 1 flatten the work so that the 2 you should have 12-13 stitches left remaining stitches line up as shown on round 12 stuff with polyester below sew the first 3 pairs of fibrefill stitches from the tail together © akabekobotan 2024 3 distribute the remaining stitches on 4 using contrasting yarn of a lighter either side of the seam as shown weight if desired embroider eyes below and sew across the edges between rounds 6 and 7 as shown weave in any remaining yarn with french knots and the mouth over round 5 with straight stitches alternatively substitute 5mm safety eyes for the french knots 5 optional extra detail uh yeah 6 and you re done give your itty bitty kitty a bit of personality by changing up the facial details go nuts there is incidently no way of talking about cats that enables one to come off as a sane person dan greenberg © akabekobotan 2024
